comment: Absolutely adore Dr. Unwin!!  Yes, biology is hard, he'll tell you that himself.  Yes, you have to study, he'll tell you that himself.  He will also do anything he can to help you. He is both helpful and very nice and any negative comments you see are most likely from slackers who though they could or should get an easy A.  I recommend taking him.

LOVED Dr. Unwin!! It is rare to find a biology professor that is not only approachable but also really cares about how his students do in the class. He loves what he does and he keeps the material interesting and relevant. He'll push you but you'll learn a lot. Been at KSU for over 3 years and he's easily one of my favorite profs. I'll miss him!

Unwin is great! He really wants you to succeed. You have to study a lot but this is a upper level class so you can't get around it. He's very picky about lab reports, but only because he wants to make sure you really learn how to do it. Always available for help, and gives extra credit. Lecture style is great, one of the best professors I've had.

Going to clear some air about unwin. Positives first: available to help, loves answering questions. Negatives: academic rigor, I typically get a's with an occasional b. In Unwin I struggled for a C. The output for your input ratio for studying to obtain a grade is never satisfying. Nice person, rough professor. If you like tough take him!

The man was an amazing teacher. If you want to learn biology take him. The down side was his test are extremely hard. All multipule choice, but very detailed. You will have to study quite a bit for this class and the book is the best way to do it. READ! The lab itself didn't matter much, as long as you did the work, right/wrong you still were okay

Excellent professor! He really likes to see his students excel. He will help you with anything as long as you try to help yourself(he doesn't do your work for you). His door is always open for help. He knows his stuff and will always give you the information you need for an exam. If you don't you well, it is b/c you have not been paying attention

I hated this teacher to begin with because I failed the first test miserably. His tests are over 300pgs and he gives very detailed questions. He's big into fill-in-the-blank pop quizzes. I did not like him, but if you study and read everyday then you should do fine. I got a 91 on 2nd tests & 88 on 3rd. Still got C in the class. Be prepared to study

He was a great teacher.  His test aren't really hard if you studied. He wants you to apply the conceptual knowledge you used not just memorize (this is why he has essays).  I am really glad I had him as a teacher he was easy to talk to.  Just READ READ READ. The book is the most important thing. If you read and ask questions you will do just fine!

I think he's a great teacher and I wish I had him for BIOL 2.  You HAVE to study.  If you don't, you'll fail, but that's college so you really have to get used to it especially if you want to go further than undergrad.  He's easy to talk to.  He seemed to get sidetracked later in the semester and it showed, but other than that, EXCELLENT!

I thought his class was hard and he was a perfectionist but actually his teaching has helped me with other BIOL courses. His labs are truly hard and you really have to do it his way otherwise he will fail you in a heart beat. Ask for his help, he will always be there.
This is the second time Ive had him. If I could Id take him again. Hes not up tight and jokes around a lil. Kinda shocked about the bad comments.
He is a great teacher will helps with learning. And hot. Like his personal style.

I liked the class dont get me wrong it does require alot of outside study time but overall hes a good teacher. he does give pop quizs but they only help he counts what you get right as bonus towards the exam. the exams are challengeing i got B s on the first 2 i think the overall avg was 73 ish. i would take him again no problem.

HE IS THE WORST PROFESSOR EVER!! I have studied for hours and weeks and have not been able to pass his exams!He gives notes on powerpoint, but basically you would be better off staying at home and teaching yourself b/c HE DOES NOT know how to teach ppl! His exams are impossible and he gives a load of assignments in both his lecture and in his labs!
